CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C02

TI_TEXT.P: Транспортни услуги (с изключение на извозването на отпадъци)
Servicios de transporte (excluido el transporte de residuos)
Services de transport (à l'exclusion du transport des déchets)
Servizi di trasporto (escluso il trasporto di rifiuti)
Servizzi ta' trasport (eskluż it-trasport ta' l-iskart)
Serviços de transporte (excl. transporte de resíduos)
Servicii de transport (cu excepţia transportului de deşeuri)

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of Transportation Services for Aberdeenshire Council through a Dynamic Purchasing Service.

Mainstream School Transport Services are dedicated Home-to-School transport (or Music Centre) services operated by Public Service Vehicles, licensed taxis or private hire cars. The Council specifies the vehicle size and type and also provides a pupil manifest.

Minimum Cost School Transport Services are combined Home-to-School transport/local bus services that are registered with the Traffic Commissioner. The Council specifies the route, timetable, vehicle size and type and fares / ticketing requirements. On these services, the Council retains the fare box revenue.
South Dedicated School Transport contracts, South Minimum Cost School Transport contracts and South Music Centre contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 19.8.2019.
North Dedicated School Transport contracts, North Minimum Cost School Transport contracts and North Music Centre contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 17.8.2020.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As the DPS is a 2 Stage Process and suppliers can join who pass the minimum selection criteria it is not known the total number of suppliers who will join at this time.

INFO_ADD.P: Operator's Licence or European equivalent; Special Restricted Operator’s Licence; Licensed in accordance with relative Authority; Motor Insurance including use for hire; Public liability insurance; Employers’ liability insurance; CPC for Transport Managers; PSV Vehicles meet EURO III emission standards; Vehicle Fleet List — If relevant / required.

TITLE.P: Local Bus Services and Combined Local Bus / School Transport Services

SHORT_DESCR.P: Local Bus services are services as defined by Section 2 of the Transport Act 1985 and registered with the Traffic Commissioner. The Council specifies the route, timetable, vehicle size and type, and fares/ticketing requirements. On these services, the operator retains the fare box revenue.

Combined Local Bus/School Transport Services are as above, but include journeys to/from schools carrying children entitled to home to school transport. The Council additionally provides a pupil manifest.
South Local Bus contracts and South Combined Local Bus / School Transport contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 19.8.2019.
North Local Bus contracts and North Combined Local Bus / School Transport contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 17.8.2020.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As the DPS is a 2 Stage Process and suppliers can join if they pass the minimum selection criteria, it is not known the total number of suppliers who will join at this time.

INFO_ADD.P: Operator's Licence or European equivalent; Special Restricted Operator’s Licence; Licensed in accordance with relative Authority; Motor Insurance including use for hire; Public liability insurance; Employers’ liability insurance.
CPC for Transport Managers; PSV Vehicles meet EURO III emission standards; Vehicle Fleet List — If relevant / required.

SHORT_DESCR.P: A2B Dial-a-Bus services are registered with the Traffic Commissioner. Individual contracts will specify whether the service can be operated by either (a) Public Service Vehicles and / or (b) licensed taxis or private hire cars (PHCs). If operated by taxis or PHCs the operator must hold or obtain a Special Restricted Operator Licence.

Some dial-a-bus services may have a specified route and timetable which can vary from day to day based on passenger bookings. Other dial-a-bus services may operate on a more flexible basis whereby the Council specifies the operating area and times, with daily pick-ups and drop-offs determined by passenger bookings.

Bookings are handled by the Passenger Transport Unit and these are notified to the operator the day before travel. The Council provides drivers with equipment to enable direct communication with the Passenger Transport Unit.
South A2B Dial-a-Bus contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 19.8.2019.
North A2B Dial-a-Bus contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 17.8.2020.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As the DPS is a 2 Stage Process and suppliers can join who pass the minimum selection criteria it is not known the total number of suppliers who will join at this time.

INFO_ADD.P: Operator's Licence or European equivalent; Special Restricted Operator’s Licence; Licensed in accordance with relative Authority; Motor Insurance including use for hire; Public liability insurance; Employers’ liability insurance; CPC for Transport Managers; PSV Vehicles meet EURO III emission standards; Vehicle Fleet List — If relevant / required.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Additional Support Needs School Transport Services are dedicated Home-to-School transport services for pupils with Additional Support Needs and can be operated by Public Service Vehicles, licensed taxis or private hire cars. The Council specifies the vehicle size and type and also provides a pupil manifest.
Additional Support Needs contracts to Camphill School will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 13.8.2018.
All other Additional Support Needs contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 20.8.2018.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As the DPS is a 2 Stage Process and suppliers can join who pass the minimum selection criteria it is not known the total number of suppliers who will join at this time.

INFO_ADD.P: Operator's Licence or European equivalent; Special Restricted Operator’s Licence; Licensed in accordance with relative Authority; Motor Insurance including use for hire; Public liability insurance; Employers’ liability insurance; CPC for Transport Managers; PSV Vehicles meet EURO III emission standards; Vehicle Fleet List.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Social Care Transport Services are dedicated services that are provided for the elderly and infirm or adults with a range of disabilities and can be operated by Public Service Vehicles, licensed taxis or private hire cars. The Council specifies the vehicle size and type and also provides a service user manifest.
All Social Care Contracts will be tendered in order to begin on week commencing Monday 28.10.2019.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As the DPS is a 2 Stage Process and suppliers can join who pass the minimum selection criteria it is not known the total number of suppliers who will join at this time.

INFO_ADD.P: Operator's Licence or European equivalent; Special Restricted Operator’s Licence; Licensed in accordance with relative Authority; Motor Insurance including use for hire; Public liability insurance; Employers’ liability insurance; CPC for Transport Managers; PSV Vehicles meet EURO III emission standards; Vehicle Fleet List — If relevant / required.

SUITABILITY.P: Please see PCS-Tender for professional activity and selection criteria with ESPD (Scotland) document. https://www.publictendersscotland.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Performance conditions will be detailed within the documentation pertaining to each Lot.

INFO_ADD_EAUCTION.P: The Council reserves the right to run electronic auctions as part of the further competition process for awarding individual work packages under the contracts created as a result of this Tender process.

ESTIMATED_TIMING.P: As part of the DPS, various Lots will be advertised throughout. Please see Lot description for timeframe.

INFO_ADD.P: To register your interest in this notice and obtain additional information please visit https://www.publictendersscotland.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk - Reference Number - 10706.
The buyer is using PCS-Tender to conduct this PQQ exercise. The Project code is 10706. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2343.
The Contracting Authority does not intend to include any community benefit requirements in this contract for the following reason:
Aberdeenshire Council does not intend to include any community benefit requirements in this contract for the following reason:

There will be a wide and varied supply base delivering the contractual requirements, and it would be difficult to devise and manage fair community benefits requirements across such a diverse contractual and supply base.

This type of contractual arrangements in itself delivers a community benefit through the outputs tending to be the use of a highly localised SME supply chain, therefore delivering socio-economic benefits to the local area.
